body:
I try with disabled_function and works correctly. 'set_time_limit' is in "disabled_function" string.
Thanks!
@rob006 safe mode went away in PHP 5.4 (https://secure.php.net/manual/en/features.safe-mode.php), so probably not necessary to worry about
Basically any function may be disabled by `disable_functions`. This creates dangerous precedent which may result in constant requests to check whether the function is available before using it.
Any function _can_ be disabled by `disable_functions`. The reality is that there are a handful of common ones that tend to be disabled in shared hosting environments.

The reality is that some really weird functions sometimes becomes disabled, AFAIR we already had reports about `symlink()` or `ini_set()`. `set_time_limit()` was reported once (?), request was rejected and workaround is really easy: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/15679#issuecomment-388757423 . 
2 reports for 5 years is not really that common. 

But if we really want to fix it, I would not handle this by searching function name in `disable_functions` setting and I would not simply ignore error - it should be logged. `function_exists` or `@` operator should be faster and does not explicitly suggest that we support some exotic `disable_functions` configurations.

issue.title: Update Response.php

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
set_time_limit() has been disabled for security reasons on some shared hosting

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes

body:
That workaround linked above [doesnâ€™t work](https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.function-exists.php#67947) if `set_time_limit()` is disabled via `disable_functions`:

> function_exists will return false for functions disabled with the disable_functions ini directive. However those functions are still declared so trying to define them yourself will fail. 

So it would be worth updating Response.php to either wrap the `set_time_limit()` call with a `function_exists()` check (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/15679#issuecomment-366760359), or remove the call altogether (https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/15679#issuecomment-366876634).

issue.title: Fix #16531: check if set_time_limit() exists before calling it

repository.name: yii2

body:
I like @brandonkelly solution.

Although not part of this issue, I do not think it is good idea to use `set_time_limit(0)` in web request.
